    • firstTime

      private boolean firstTime
      True if the player still hasn't moved. Gets reset by GameTable.nextTurn(). Used mostly by gods which can do the same thing twice.

  • Constructor Details

    • Player

      public Player​(java.lang.String nickname, GameTable gameTable, SocketClientConnection c) throws NickAlreadyTakenException
      Constructor for player; once the object is built, it gets added to the player list in GameTable.
      Parameters:
      nickname - player's nickname
      gameTable - game-specific table
      c - player's socket connection
      Throws:
      NickAlreadyTakenException - when nick already taken
      java.lang.NullPointerException - when the gametable has not been initialized (shouldn't happen btw)

    • Player

      @Deprecated Player​(java.lang.String nickname, GameTable g, java.lang.String god) throws NickAlreadyTakenException, java.lang.NullPointerException
      Deprecated.
      DEBUG package-private constructor only used in tests
      Throws:
      NickAlreadyTakenException
      java.lang.NullPointerException

    • initBuilderList

      public void initBuilderList​(Cell position) throws InvalidBuildException, java.lang.NoSuchMethodException, java.lang.IllegalAccessException, java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException, java.lang.InstantiationException
      This function gets called twice per player by the controller, to initialize the player's builders
      Parameters:
      position - position on which the builder is to be placed
      Throws:
      InvalidBuildException - when the builder is trying to be placed on an occupied cell, or the player already has two builders, or the god is not in the server conf
      java.lang.NoSuchMethodException
      java.lang.IllegalAccessException
      java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
      java.lang.InstantiationException

    • hasBuilder

      public boolean hasBuilder()
      Returns:
      true if this player's builderList is empty

    • checkConditions

      void checkConditions​(Builder builder) throws NoMoreMovesException
      Checks if the player meets the necessary conditions to continue playing.
      Parameters:
      builder - builder to be checked (null if both builders need to be checked)
      Throws:
      NoMoreMovesException - if the player does not meet playable conditions (aka he can't move/build)

    • checkMovePreConditions

      private void checkMovePreConditions​(Builder builder) throws NoMoreMovesException
      Checks for available feasible moves
      Parameters:
      builder - builder to be checked (null if both)
      Throws:
      NoMoreMovesException - if no feasible moves are found

    • checkBuildPreConditions

      Parameters:

      Throws:
      NoMoreMovesException - if no feasible builds are found
